author: jimmygchen
content:
Hey sorry <@504202741933932544> I'm a bit late to this, but just reading through the `BlobSidecarsByRoot` changes and have a minor question. I wonder if the wording below should be `MUST NOT` instead? because we only start serving blobs after gossip validation, so it shouldn't be possible to serve blobs that fails gossip validation?
> Clients SHOULD NOT respond with sidecars related to blocks that fail gossip validation rules.

author: tbenr
content: The reason of the SHOULD NOT is that allows clients to serve those blobs without waiting the corresponding block to come in and gossip-validated

author: tbenr
content: MUST NOT implies that you cannot do that until you are 100% sure that the associated block passes the gossip rules.

author: tbenr
content: <@425572898787426305> am I correct in the explanation?

author: m.kalinin
content: <@504202741933932544> yes! <@466006586477772831> imagine the situation where the associated block isn't around yet, MUST NOT would restrict a node to serve sidecars only after the block has been received
